text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== As a professional athlete, she was played with the Women's United Soccer Association from 2001 to 2003. In 2004 she was named Women's Player of the Year for the Asian Football Confederation. In 2009 and 2010, Sawa was part of Women's Professional Soccer.Women's Professional Soccer, "WPS Holds Initial International Draft," September 24, 2008; retrieved 2012-3-12. Sawa has played for the Japan national team, including the team which won the 2011 World Cup. "Women's World Cup: Japan celebrate win on penalties," BBC. July 18, 2011; retrieved 20112. She participated in the last five World Cups.CBC Sports, "Team profile: Japan"; retrieved 2012-3-13. Sawa was part of the women's team at the 1996, the 2004, the 2008.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), Homare Sawa ; retrieved 2012-3-12. She was a member of the team which won a silver medal in the 2012 Summer Olympics at London.London2012.com, Homare Sawa ; "Japan's women footballers irked by Olympic flight seating," BBC.
